result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason G. Lobe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Probation concurrent with probation in 13CF460

miscConds.notes: Defendant to maintain full time employment or school.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Comply with any conditions per agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

records.addlTxt: DEF PRESENT W/ATTY HAMM - PLEA NO CONTEST TO CT 2 - FOUND GUILTY - CT 1 DISMISSED & READ IN - SENTENCED TO 18 MONTHS INITIAL CONFINEMENT AND 18 MONTHS EXTENDED SUPERVISION CONSECUTIVE TO 13CF460, IMPOSED AND STAYED AND PLACED ON 5 YEARS PROBATION W/CONDITIONS - PROBATION CONCURRENT WITH 13CF460 - BOND CONDITIONS MODIFIED - BOND TO REMAIN IN EFFECT UNTIL REPORTS TO JAIL IN 13CF460

May not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON POSTING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew is imposed from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m. except for work purposes, treatment purposes, NA or AA as approved by the Bond Monitoring Program and to attend Technical College but must provide school schedule.
Defendant can only be released from custody Monday through Friday 8:00 a.m. - 3:30 p.m. so defendant can sign up for the Bond Monitoring Program.
Defendant is allowed to attend parent/teacher conferences but must notify Monroe County Justice Department in advance and get approval from them.
